NATIONAL ASSOCIATION OF EDUCATIONAL BROADCASTERS
OFFICE OF THE REGIONAL DIRECTOR
KTCA-TV
St. Paul 8, Minnesota
February 19, I960
Harold Hill
Room lU, Gregory Hall
University of Illinois
Urbana, Illinois
Dear Harold:
Enclosed is an information sheet on a project that has been kicking
around in the NAEB Utilization Committee for some time. As you can
see, this is a project designed to prepare and distribute information
kits to help local groups develop utilization of educational broad¬
casts.
We are trying to locate people who will work with us in developing some
of these kits. I’m sure you will agree with us that there is a lot
still to be done in the utilization field, Perhaps the best way to get
at this request is to list some specific questions for your consideration.
1. Do you have any material now available that would fit into this
type of kit distribution? If so, could you give me a brief
description of it and indicate how it might be made available to
the NAEB?
2. Will you be able to undertake the production of a utilization
kit if the cost could be underwritten? If so, would you outline
your ideas?
3. If you do not have any material or are not in a position to pro¬
duce material, can you give me the names of people who might be
able to help? Should I contact them or will you?
U. Whether or not you can participate, would you please give me
your reaction and comments about the project?
I know this is asking for a lot of your time, but the results will more
than justify our presumptiousness. If you need more information about
the proposed kits drop me a line and I will try to secure the answers.
Sincerely,
Clair R. Tettemer
Chairman
Television Sub-committee
NAEB Utilization Committee
CRT/gvc
Enel.
